dedicated_server_interfaces_introduction: In this section, you can find all information related to your server’s network interfaces.
dedicated_server_interfaces_vrack_inform: Please note that by default, no IPs exist for the private network (vRack). You will need to create a private network (vRack) beforehand, add your server to it, then configure your IPs.
Find out more about the vRack
dedicated_server_interfaces_step_checker: OLA OVHcloud Link Aggregation
Enable and configure OLA in private aggregation
To find out more,
take a look at our guides
Redundant connectivity
Secure servers
Easily reversible
Free
With OLA, you can now use your OVHcloud server’s network connections.

You can then attach your server’s network interfaces (physical network cards) to create a single virtual network interface. You can also add additional bandwidth (only for aggregation on the vRack private network)
Currently available for the vRack private network only
Get the launch offer for {{ discountPrice }} instead of {{ price }} ex. VAT/month for the first three months.
Clearing the network interfaces
OLA is now enabled.
Before you configure your option, please ensure that you have deleted any private networks connected to your network interfaces, as well as any failover IPs.
I have done this, go to the next step
Configuration
It is now time to configure your interfaces, choose the mode you want, and select your interfaces.
Configure
IPMI KVM
OLA is now enabled and configured.
You can now manually monitor the procedure via the IPMI KVM, detailed in the guide, in order for your network to start working. Without this procedure, the configuration will not be complete.
I have done this, go to the next step
Ready
Everything is ready! Your network interfaces are now configured.

If you would like to reset them to your original configuration, please select “Modify”. You can also cancel your option, but please remember to reset your configuration to default, otherwise your network will be inactive.
Done
dedicated_server_interfaces_ola_activate: Your network interface configuration has been modified via OLA. If you would like to reset it to the default configuration, please modify the OLA configuration.
dedicated_server_interfaces_ola_alert_co: You need to monitor the procedure via the IPMI KVM, detailed in the guide, in order for your network to start working. Without this procedure, the configuration will not be complete.
dedicated_server_interfaces_loading_mess: Your interfaces are being modified. Please wait a few minutes.
dedicated_server_interfaces_do_not_close: This operation could take a few minutes. Please do not close this page.
dedicated_server_interfaces_detach_priva: Are you sure you want to detach the “{{vrack}}” vRack from the {{interface}} interface?
dedicated_server_interfaces_bandwith_des: Incoming public bandwidth (to and from the internet) is not limited. You can increase your public and private bandwidth by signing up to the following options:
dedicated_server_interfaces_current_oper: An operation is in progress on this server
dedicated_server_interfaces_task_error: An error has occurred during configuration: {{ errorMessage }}
dedicated_server_interfaces_step_checker: Extend bandwidth
dedicated_server_interfaces_ola_alert_co: You will need to configure it manually via the IPMI KVM.
dedicated_server_interfaces_bandwith_ola: To ensure that the aggregation configuration is completely private, your outgoing public bandwidth option will not be used, because the interface dedicated to the public network will be used for the private network.
